item.description:
Hail! I've been hosting a monthly Hartford area "meet and greet" for the Connecticut Wiccan and Pagan Network this past year. December will be my last such. It will take place at Borders Book Store in Farmington (just 1/4 mile from the Westfarms Mall in West Hartford, easy to get to off I-84).

The theme was already set as "Yule and Community." *chuckle* How heathen can you get? We can swap bits of lore and ideas about the pre-Christian practices of our ancestors during the bleak midwinter... as well as share stories of our own Yuletide traditions both old and new.

Info about the Borders store (including directions) here.

Info about the December event as originally posted.

Anyway, for those who don't know me, I am a member of the Connecticut-based Two Ravens Kindred these past four years. Currently serving as the Public Relations Officer for The Troth and am proposed Troth Steward for Connecticut next year. I won't call myself a skald, but I do have a lamentable tendency to sing and recite verse in public. Having just completed a workshop on brewing, I am very excited about making my first batch of mead next month!

I'm taking this opportunity to transition my "second Monday of the month" experience from being one of hanging out with any random pagan that happens to show up -- rarely rewarding -- to one of helping build and strengthen the heathen community in Connecticut.

After December, ongoing meetups can be lore nights, or social gatherings (PubMoot!), or special events. We'll take the "pulse" of whoever shows up at this first opportunity to get together and see what feels right.

My goal is for newcomers to feel every bit as welcome as the veterans. Knowing the quality of the existing heathen community throughout the Northeast, I have no doubt that those who sincerely wish to find a seat at the table, will have little trouble doing so.

That's about it for now. RSVP, so I know how many to expect and can give Borders a heads up about the impending Viking invasion. *grin*

Yours in frith and honor,
Mike
